website_summaries.verdict: Ubisoft makes some good changes to its Assassin's Creed formula with Unity, but the game is doomed to mediocrity due to its lack of polish and originality.
cons: Removes interesting and useful assassin abilities from previous games

customer_reviews.title: loving it!
customer_reviews.text: this game works great now after all of the patches. there is so much content, so much to do. it is impressive to think about all of the work that went into creating this game. the textures, the drawing/building, all of the history and stories, it is so easy to get sucked into this time period. There will always be some things that are annoying but the pros outweigh the cons. it really is a well-made game when it is running as intended and worth every penny for its entertainment value.

You can virtually never run out of activities, missions, challenges, and things to do of all sorts in this game of Unity. And given that you can team up with other assassin's (real friends or strangers) in numerous missions and co-op WHEN YOU CHOOSE, makes this a true game changer gaming. You wanna be a loner, be a loner. You wanna be social, be social. YOU DEFINE THIS GAME!!! The graphics are the best yet with stunning visual effects, interactions in battle and on the streets of Paris. THIS IS A TRUE MASTERPIECE FOR AC DEVELOPERS & GAMERS!!! ^5

customer_reviews.title: A hot mess eventually made good.
customer_reviews.text: This game was a rushed and buggy mess when it came out. But after all the patches it's actually a great game. The graphics are beautiful, the story is interesting, the city is teeming with life, and you get a real sense of the incredible divide between the rich and poor during the French Revolution. Assassin's Creed as a series has a lot of issues, but that's Ubisoft's fault, not the developers and testers and designers who clearly poured passion into this project. If you haven't tried this game I'd recommend giving it a shot, especially when it's on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Chapman

customer_reviews.title: A competent game that runs incompetently
customer_reviews.text: A perfectly competent game from a gameplay perspective, completely ruined by its performance. With an i7 4790K/GTX980/16GB DDR3 this game should run great at 1080p, but still struggles hard to maintain 60 fps, and even then there's artifacting and strange bugs, people falling out of the sky, into the ground. Black Flag was bad too, but at least playable, this one is borderline playable. It's a shame too since the modern sci-fi segments of the game where your character gets warped into some future dimension are some of the most interesting parts of the game.

customer_reviews.title: Ubi Uber-Disaster
customer_reviews.text: The game had been unplayable essentially for over a month. With crashes, stuttering, and lag the game was a chore to play. Thus, I haven't picked it back up as of yet. Hopefully this fiasco would incline ubi, as well as other developers, to work to actually ensure their game is functional for the people who pay full price for their game.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie

customer_reviews.title: No launch day fun for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought hard copy for PC (no high speed Internet out here in the sticks). Spent a couple hours putting in discs for install and then waiting for UPlay patch to download, then pressed play only to be told my game was corrupted, had a Virus (sic), or had been cracked. No launch day fun for me. I'll update my review when it gets fixed.

customer_reviews.title: It'd be nice if we could go back to that
customer_reviews.text: This will be my last Assassin's Creed game. From UPlay's extremely slow download rates to an almost completely unplayable game. Full of bugs and crashes all the time. It'd be nice if we could go back to that. Thanks.

product_meta.title: Assassin's Creed Unity
product_meta.description: The exclusive and prestigious Assassin’s Creed Unity Guillotine Collector’s Case is the definitive collection of Assassin’s treasures for the ultimate Assassin’s Creed fan. This collector box contains an amazing figurine of Arno standing on a guillotine rallying the revolutionaries, an artbook, 2 lithographs, the game official soundtrack, an exclusive FuturePak, a secret map of Paris based on the in-game version, a fully customized Tarot card game, a framed canvas print inspired from the painting of that era and a wooden music box playing a dear theme to every fan of the Assassin’s Creed saga. You will also get access to 2 single player missions for an extra 45 minutes of gameplay as well as single player items including multiple extra outfits and weapons! Physical content A 41cm-high figurine of Arno on a bloody Guillotine Exclusive Guillotine Collector’s Box An exclusive FuturePak A high quality artbook including concept art that inspired the game The official game soundtrack 2 lithographs in a stylized envelope A secret map of Paris based on the in-game version A fully customized Tarot card game A framed canvas print A wooden music box 1 Mission (The Chemical Revolution - 30 min), The Prussian Pack, the Musketeer Pack, the Shooter Pack (gears and weapons) and the Parade Pistol (weapon). INSURED DELIVERY WITH TRACKING TO ALL DESTINATIONS
feature_bullets: UNIQUE CO-OP EXPERIENCE YOU MUST PLAY TO BELIEVE: In addition to an epic single-player campaign, join with up to three friends online and experience the open world of 18th-century Paris

A RUTHLESS NEW HERO FOR A BRUTAL WORLD: Play as Arno, an entirely new breed of Assassin, and take down your prey with a range of new weapons such as the Phantom Blade, a hidden blade with crossbow capabilities

DEEP CUSTOMIZATION OF ARNO, THE MASTER ASSASSIN: Craft a unique play style by choosing weapons, gear, outfits, and specialized skills. Mix and match from hundreds of possible combinations and build your stealth, fighting, and navigation abilities
DISCOVER REVOLUTIONARY PARIS, BROUGHT TO LIFE AS NEVER BEFORE: Carve through the stunning full-scale open world city, a feat only made possible through the power of an all-new game engine
